Kentucky Scholarships


1Lt Eric D. Yates Scholarship Fund
Must be a full-time sophomore, junior, or senior and an active member of the WKU ROTC. Must be a student who wishes to continue his or her education and was already a student at WKU when he or she joined the WKU ROTC program. Financial need is an important consideration. Must not be receiving other scholarships through the ROTC program. more...

A. A. Gorin Scholarship Fund For Green County Students
Must be a full-time student and a resident of Green County in Kentucky. more...

A. David Nichols Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate students attending Northern Kentucky University who are enrolled in the Chase College of Law. Applicants must have academic merit and financial need. Number of awards and award amount varies. Nonrenewable. more...

A. Elisabeth Potts Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Northern Kentucky University who are majoring in Elementary Education. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Number of awards and award amount varies. Nonrenewable. more...

A. Frank & Bethel C. Gallaher Memorial Music Award
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Morehead State University who participate in the schools Music program. Selection based on academic achievement, talent, and potential. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. Contact the Department of Music for more information. more...

A.A. Gorin Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from Green County High School planning to attend full-time at Western Kentucky University. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Murray State University who are majoring in Mathematics or Physical Science. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, financial need, and be U.S. citizens. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Scholarship for sophomores or juniors attending Northern Kentucky University who are enrolled in NKUs Honors Program. Number of awards and award amount varies. Nonrenewable. more...

Academic Grant 1St Time Students
Scholarship for first-time freshmen enrolling at Kentucky State University. Applicants must have a 2.8-2.99 GPA and ACT score of 18-20 or SAT score of 870-950. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Academic Scholarships (A)
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolling at the University of Kentucky. Applicants must have a minimum ACT score of 28 or a minimum SAT score of 1240 and a minimum 3.3 GPA. Due date, number of awards and award amounts may vary. more...

Academic Scholarships (B)
Scholarship for current undergraduate or transfer students at the University of Kentucky. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and completed a minimum of 12 credit hours. Due date, number of awards and award amounts may vary. more...

Account Control Technology Foundation
ACT Cares Community Scholarship Program
The ACT Cares Scholarship Program is for graduating seniors from high schools in communities surrounding Account Control Technology, Inc.’s offices. An applicant must be a current senior at a high school located in one of the counties listed for the following communities:
•Bakersfield, CA = Kern County
•Woodland Hills, CA = Los Angeles County
•Mason, OH = Butler, Clermont, Hamilton or Warren Counties
•Dallas, TX = Dallas, Denton or Collin Counties
•San Angelo, TX = Tom Green County more...

Achievers Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Indiana, Kentucky, or Ohio who are first-time freshmen enrolling at Northern Kentucky University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and a minimum ACT score of 23. Number of awards and award amount varies. Select counties in Indiana are not eligible Renewable. more...

Scholarship for seniors attending Murray State University who are majoring in Health, Physical Education & Recreation. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Adams Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Anderson, Campbell, Claiborne, or Scott counties, Tennessee or Roane State tranfers who are undergraduate students attending University of the Cumberlands. Selection based on merit, service, and participation in activities. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Addiction Resource
AddictionResource.com awards $3,000 in scholarships each year to students who share their vision for an addiction-free world.
Addictive substances abuse has killed more people than every American war combined, and more than 10 times over. Many victims of drug addictions feel as though they are fighting a war themselves.
Through the years, millions of lives have been damaged due to drug abuse and addiction. In the US, there are an estimated 3.6 million people who are addicted to some form of drug, whether for recreation or by prescription. These include people who accidentally become dependent, and eventually addicted to painkillers like Opioids.
With the AddictionResource Scholarship, we want to challenge current and prospective college students to share their story on how we can make the world addiction-free. more...

Addie Beth & Dr. Carroll Hubbard Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of the western Kentucky Purchase area who are incoming freshmen enrolling at Murray State University. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.2. Former recipients may reapply for consideration. Applicants must submit a sample of his/her writing. more...

Alumni Tuition Discount
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Brescia University who are alumnus or dependents of alumnus. Applicants who are alumnus must obtained a B.A., B.S. or B.S.W. from BU; dependents must be children under the age of 25 or spouses. Students must file for federal and Kentucky State financial aid. Alumnus recieve a 25% tuition discount and dependents receive a 10% tuition discount. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

American Indian Graduate Center
The American Indian Graduate Center (AIGC) is a national private 501©(3) non profit headquartered in Albuquerque, New Mexico providing fellowships to American Indian and Alaska Native graduate students throughout the United States. Established in 1969, AIGC has disbursed more than 15,000 graduate fellowships with the support of the Bureau of Indian Education, corporate and foundation partnerships, and our generous alumni and private donors.In 2001 AIGC Scholars was incorporated as a partner in the Gates Millennium Scholars Program, to help native communities successfully access the prestigious GMS scholarship, and to provide financial and academic support to the 1500 American Indian and Alaska Native students who earn this award through 2020. more...

American Legion Post 23 Roger Miller Scholarship
Must be a full-time student and a graduate of a Warren County or Bowling Green, Kentucky high school. Preference is given to children or grandchildren of members of American Legion Post 23. more...

Army Emergency Relief Scholarships
Army Emergency Relief maintains two scholarship programs – the Spouse Education Assistance Program and the MG James Ursano Scholarship Program for dependent children. Both scholarships provide financial assistance for students who are pursuing their first undergraduate degree. Scholarship applications are accepted from 2 January to 1 May each year for assistance for the following academic year.Scholarship award amounts are not guaranteed and vary each year based on the total number of applicants in each program and budget amount allotted to the scholarship programs.Choose the appropriate program under the Scholarships Tab for further details and instructions. more...

Arndt M. Stickles Scholarship Fund

Arnold Family Scholarship Fund
Must be a full-time student with a minimum GPA of 2.75 and majoring in a discipline within the Gordon Ford College of Business. Award is renewable for up to three years provided the recipient maintains the established criteria. more...

Arnold G. Taylor Scholarship Fund
Must be a full-time student majoring in Agriculture within the Department of Agriculture and Food Science in the Ogden College of Science and Engineering. Preference will be given to a student intending to work on a small-scale, diversified farm, with a preference for organic/regenerative/agro-ecological farm production. Ideally, the student will be committed to small-scale farming that is based in building soil fertility, using water efficiently, minimizing or eliminating chemical inputs, minimizing soil erosion, and fostering native biodiversity in order to contribute to healthier watersheds, regional food systems, and vibrant local economies. Financial aid is to be considered. more...

Arnold Robinson Scholarship Fund
Must be a full-time student participating in WKU football. Financial need is an important consideration. more...

16/17 Scholarship SummaryAxol Bioscience is excited to offer future life scientists the opportunity to receive $2000 in funding for any life science related degree program.Eligibility criteriaApplicants must be enrolled or accepted for a graduate or undergraduate degree (BSc or higher) for the 16/17 academic year at a recognized university.The degree program / research area must be in a life science field with a ‘wet-lab’ component (bench-based research such as molecular or cell biology); medicine, veterinary and pharmacy students are not eligible.Open worldwide more...

Cj And Ingrid Woods Scholarship Fund
Must be a full-time junior or senior pursuing a major within the College of Education and Behavioral Sciences and be in good academic standing with the University. Must have financial need and demonstrate characteristics that support WKU’s goal of promoting a diverse student body as a critical component to its educational mission. As part of this process, it is the preference of the donors that consideration be given to students who are members of an underrepresented and historically disadvantaged group (Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, American Indian or Alaskan Native, Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander, Asian or Asian American, or two or more races). In the event there are equally qualified candidates, it is the preference of the donor that consideration be given to a Black or African American student and second consideration be given to a Hispanic or Latinx student in support of the goal of a diverse student body so long as the effect of this scholarship does not discriminate against any other students from receiving equal consideration of financial aid funds from the pooling effect of available scholarship opportunities. This award is automatically renewable for one year provided that the recipient was a junior when the award was first received and the student maintains good academic standing with the University. Must demonstrate financial need.
Key Words: Black or African American, Hispanic or Latino/Latina/Latinx, American Indian or Alaskan Native, Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander, Asian or Asian American, Minority, Underrepresented more...

This award provides full tuition, room, board and books. more...

Freedom Alliance Scholarship Fund
The Freedom Alliance Scholarship Fund was the vision of Freedom Alliance founders LtCol Oliver North, USMC (Ret.) and the late LtGen Edward Bronars, USMC. The Freedom Alliance Scholarship Fund honors Americans in our Armed Forces who have sacrificed life or limb defending our country by providing educational scholarships for their children.The mission of the Freedom Alliance Scholarship Fund is two-fold. First, it helps offset the high cost of a college education for the sons and daughters of American heroes. Second, it is a reminder to the recipient that their parents’ sacrifice will never be forgotten by a grateful nation.The dependent children of U.S. military personnel who have been killed or permanently disabled in an operational mission or training accident are eligible to apply. Also eligible are students who have a parent classified as a Prisoner of War or Missing in Action.The generosity of patriotic Americans has made it possible for the Freedom Alliance Scholarship Fund to award more than $7 million in college scholarships to the sons and daughters of American heroes. more...

Freshmen Scholarship & Grant Awards

Award amount ranges from $2,000-$10,000 per year for five years, plus three full-tuition scholarships to the most competitive students. Number of awards varies. Contact the Institute for more information and/or application. more...

Gates Millennium Scholars Program
The Gates Millennium Scholars Program, established in 1999, was initially funded by a $1 billion grant from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. The GMS Scholarship Award Provides:Support for the cost of education by covering unmet need and self-help aid;Renewable awards for Gates Millennium Scholars maintaining satisfactory academic progress;Graduate school funding for continuing Gates Millennium Scholars in the areas of computer science, education, engineering, library science, mathematics, public health or science;Leadership development programs with distinctive personal, academic and professional growth opportunities. more...

Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation
The Truman is a very competitive national scholarship. Each year, the Foundation reviews over 600 applications for our 55 to 65 Scholarships awarded annually. These 600 applications do not include the students who compete on their own campus for one of a school’s four nominations.Although the award is competitive, we hope that our application process – while challenging – is straightforward. We hope that by providing clear information to all prospective applicants we enable everyone to produce the best application possible. more...

Hartford Technology Rental
Hartford Technology Rentals has been in the short term technology rental business for over 25 years. We feel that it is important to give back.
We are offering two $1000 scholarships that are available to students studying in the IT or related fields. Simply fill out the form and tell us about yourself and what you hope to do with your IT degree in the short essay form. One scholarship will be awarded in December and one in May (Cut-off dates: 5/15 & 12/15). You may apply for both scholarships separately. more...

John Wesley Hughes Scholarship
The John Wesley Hughes Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Asbury College. Your selection is based on your academic records, test scores, rank in class, extracurricular activities, leadership ability, letters of recommendation, an essay and an interview. You must also qualify as a President's Scholar on Level III, National Merit/Francis Asbury Scholar, or a Kentucky Governor's Scholar on Level IV to be considered. This award covers 100 percent of tuition and is renewable for up to four years with a maintained 3.6 GPA. You must be invited to compete for this award. more...

Kspe Scholarship
The Kentucky Society of Professional Engineers is offering a $2,500, one-time scholarship to one college student that meets the eligibility requirements described within the application and below. We would greatly appreciate if you all could distribute this scholarship application out to those college engineering students that are eligible. Below is more information regarding the eligibility requirements and the selection criteria for the scholarship.
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS
•Applicant must be a member of a recognized student engineering organization (e.g. KSPE, Tau Beta Pi, Chi Epsilon, ASCE, ASME, IEEE, SWE, etc.)
•Applicant must currently be enrolled in an ABET-accredited engineering program in Kentucky.
•Applicant must be accepted and enrolled in a full engineering program (NOT pre-engineering).
•Applicant must have earned at least a 3.0 grade point average (GPA) based on 4.0 scale. The GPA will be computed by KSPE based on the official transcript (hardcopy) submitted with this application. The transcript must be certified.
•Applicant must be a full-time student, and must have been enrolled in an engineering or pre-engineering program for at least 4 of the preceding semesters.
•Applicant must be a citizen of the United States.
SELECTION CRITERIA
The scholarship will be awarded on the basis of the applicant who can demonstrate that, through their engineering studies and extra curricular involvement, he or she has provided the greatest contribution to the engineering profession while maintaining a good grade point average. The following specific criteria will be considered: (Financial need will not be considered)
•Overall GPA
•Civic and Volunteer Organizations. (Include any leadership positions.)
•Professional Activities such as engineering society, scientific society, other professional organizations. (Include any offices that you now hold or have held in the past.)
•Professional publications
•Work Experience. (Include the type of work and length of employment in months.)
•Credit will be given for involvement in KSPE or the student Chapter of KSPE
•Written paragraph (less than one page) on why you want to be an Engineer. May be typed or handwritten. Attach to completed application form.
This application must be submitted by March 25, 2016. If you have any questions, please contact jennifer@kyengcenter.org more...

Life Lessons Scholarship Program
The loss of a parent or guardian is one of life’s most difficult ordeals. The emotional strain can be devastating to children and young adults. And for too many families, an untimely death also brings financial stress, making recovery all the more difficult.A college education is already a major financial challenge for most American families, but it becomes infinitely more difficult for a student when a parent dies, leaving little or no life insurance.Life insurance is an important financial safety net that parents can leave their families. Unfortunately nearly 100 million Americans don’t have life insurance, and most with coverage have far less than recommended.Recognizing the character and perseverance that so many young people show in the face of such adversity, Life Happens sponsors the annual Life Lessons Scholarship Program for college students and college-bound high school seniors. Qualified entrants who submit essays or videos about how the death of a parent impacted their lives are eligible for scholarship money. more...

Scholarship for junior tranfer students enrolling at Murray State University who are transfering from a community college. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Marian Kincaid Warns & Carl A. Warns, Jr. Scholarship
Scholarship for second-year law students or higher enrolled at Brandeis School of Law at the University of Louisville. Students must have financial need, a minimum 3.0 CGPA in all courses pertaining to labor and employment law, and have completed at least one year of full-time coursework or its equivalent. Preference given to students who demonstrate an intention to pursue a career in labor and employment law or who despite a physical disability (loss of vision, hearing or mobility impairment, etc.), are pursuing a career in law. Number of awards and award amount may vary. An essay and a copy of the SAR must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable. more...

Massmutual Financial Group
MassMutual Awards $155,000 In Scholarships To Students Across The Country
The MassMutual Scholars program is a national scholarship program for eligible students interested in careers in the insurance and financial services industry. more...

Massmutual Scholars
A national scholarship program for high achieving college students interested in pursuing careers in the insurance and financial services industry.The MassMutual Scholars Program is funded by Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company and is focused on expanding access and opportunity of higher education and employment to students who reflect the rich cultural diversity of our nation. We seek to increase the number of students completing college nationally, assist in decreasing student debt, raise awareness of careers in insurance and financial services, and recruit and retain the top talent touched by our programs.In 2015, MassMutual looks forward to offering $150,000 in total funding; assisting at least 30 students entering their sophomore, junior, senior, or fifth year of undergraduate coursework with a scholarship worth up to $5,000. Students must complete and submit for federal financial aid by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid Form (FAFSA) at www.fafsa.ed.gov and be interested in pursuing a career in the insurance and financial services industry. more...

Mometrix College Scholarships
Mometrix Test Preparation is hosting our second annual college scholarship essay contest, and we are once again looking to award students with great scholarship prizes! Submit your essay of 2000 characters (approx. 400 words) or less by May 20, 2016 to give yourself a chance to win the first, second, or third place prizes of $2,500, $1,000 and $500, respectively. Visitors will have through June 1, 2016, to cast their votes for their favorite essay, so don’t forget to tell your friends and family to vote for yours! And since we will be posting essays as we receive them, it’s to your advantage to get yours in early – the longer it’s on our site, the more opportunities people have to vote for it! more...

National Federation For The Blind Scholarship Program
To recognize achievement by blind scholars, the National Federation of the Blind annually offers blind college students in the United States and Puerto Rico the opportunity to win one of thirty merit-based, national-level scholarships worth from $3,000 to $12,000. All scholarships awarded are based on academic excellence, community service, and leadership. more...

National League For Nursing
As the only national organization funding nursing education research, the NLN is the leader in advancing the science of nursing education – furthering the scholarship of teaching and promoting evidence-based nursing education. A long record of support for rigorous, high-quality study that contributes to academic progression is reflected in the NLN’s nursing education research and grants program. more...

National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program
The National Science Foundation funds research and education in most fields of science and engineering. It does this through grants, and cooperative agreements to more than 2,000 colleges, universities, K-12 school systems, businesses, informal science organizations and other research organizations throughout the United States. The Foundation accounts for about one-fourth of federal support to academic institutions for basic research.NSF receives approximately 40,000 proposals each year for research, education and training projects, of which approximately 11,000 are funded. In addition, the Foundation receives several thousand applications for graduate and postdoctoral fellowships.The agency operates no laboratories itself but does support National Research Centers, user facilities, certain oceanographic vessels and Antarctic research stations. The Foundation also supports cooperative research between universities and industry, US participation in international scientific and engineering efforts, and educational activities at every academic level. more...

Northern Kentucky Fly Fishers, Inc., Red Barrington Scholarship
Every year NKFF selects a lucky recipient to receive our Red Barrington Scholarship grant. The requirements for this award are:The student must be currently enrolled in a Kentucky college or universityThe student must be a second year or more advanced student. Post-graduate students are eligible.The student must have a GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or betterThe student must have a declared major related to biology, chemistry, or other environmentally related study programThe student must be recommended by a current faculty memberThe student must have conducted extra-curricular projects related to the environment. Water quality or fisheries-related projects will be preferred.Prior RBSF scholarship winners are eligible. The student must request consideration, in writing, by submitting a letter explaining why they deserve the award, a verifiable GPA record, a resume and a letter of recommendation from a faculty member more...

Nurse Corps Scholarship Program
NURSE Corps Scholarship Program enables students accepted or enrolled in a diploma, associate, baccalaureate or graduate nursing programs, including RN to BSN, RN to MSN-NP, Direct Entry MSN-NP program to receive funding for tuition, fees and other educational costs in exchange for working at an eligible NURSE Corps site upon graduation.The NURSE Corps Scholarship Program is a selective program of the U.S. Government that helps alleviate the critical shortage of nurses currently experienced by certain types of health care facilities located in Health Professional Shortage Areas (HPSAs). Upon graduation, NURSE Corps Scholarship recipients work at these facilities for at least 2 years, earning the same competitive salary and benefits as any new hire.As much as half of the award funds are reserved for students pursuing a master’s level nurse practitioner degree. more...

Nursing & Allied Health Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Morehead State University who are majoring in Allied Health or Nursing. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference given to applicants from the schools service region. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. Contact the Department of Imaging Sciences or the Department of Nursing for more information. more...

Online Colleges, Scholarships, And Degree Programs
Unlike those other websites, we won’t ask you to login to search for scholarship money, we are a free resource site that exists to help you with all facets of your college experience, but most importantly with the process of choosing a school and with financing your education.Scholarship money is highly sought after because it does not have to be paid back, scholarship money is not a loan. There are plenty of scholarships out there but finding them can be difficult, there are also a lot of scams on there on the internet. We understand, and that’s why we have categorized scholarships on our website, and we don’t require a login. All the information is up to date and free to access.Scholarships are often based on need, but other times they are based on other attributes, they can be based on the race or ethnic heritage of the candidate, or on the location in which they live, they can come for institutions or corporations. The fact is that there is plenty of scholarship money out there, and much of it may go unclaimed, it’s our mission to make sure that we list legit scholarship opportunities in a format that is easily accessible for our visitors.Our website is your one stop shop for all things regarding college education, scholarships, degrees, programs, and financial aid. One of our main focuses is on centralizing the location of hordes of scholarships information.Our scholarships are broken down into categories to make it simple to browse and find all the scholarships that are appropriate for you. In addition we offer lots of tips on writing your essays and so on so that you can maximize the amount of money that you secure.Do not underestimate the power of winning scholarship money, college is expensive and every dollar that you can subtract from the bill will keep you out of any type of financial straits when you graduate. Ideally you want to keep your loans as low as possible. more...

Orton & Alice Eugenia Mackey Hamby Art Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Murray State University who are majoring in Art. Preference given to photography majors. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Orval & Wanda Mahon Horticulture Scholarship

P.O. Pistilli Scholarship
Scholarship for Afro-American, Hispanic, American Indian, Women or Disabled, graduating high school seniors attending an accredited college or university in the U.S. pursuing a career in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be U.S. residents, and have financial need. Applicants must demonstrate involvement in activities associated with the underrepresented group which they represent, demonstrate high interest and achievement in math and science courses by participation in academic and non-academic math/science activities. Renewable. A personal letter, copy of income tax return and copy of the FAFSA must be included with application packet. more...

Physically Disabled Scholarships
SchoolSoup’s research team has identified Physically Disabled Scholarships. SchoolSoup.com is considered the authority on college/university scholarships and we have listed over $40 Billion in available scholarships. We take pride in having the most comprehensive free and up to date information available online. It is possible that your profile does not match the requirements to obtain a Physically Disabled scholarship but our directory does provide you with some of the information you will need to get your application process started. more...

Scholarship for incoming freshmen or transfer students enrolling at Morehead State University who are National Merit Finalists or Semi-Finalists. Transfer students must have a minimum 3.75 college GPA on at least 15 credit hours. Finalists receive tuition, on-campus housing, and $1,500 for books and/or meals; and semi-finalists receive tuition, on-campus housing, and $500 for books and/or meals. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Renewable. more...

Quitday Scholarship
The QuitDay Scholarship essay contest is open to undergraduate and graduate students who are 18 years old or older. Applicants must be accepted to, or currently enrolled in a college or university located within the United States or in the District of Columbia. Only one (1) submission per student is allowed.
To apply for the QuitDay.org Scholarship, all you need to do is share your vision for a smoke-free world.
Applicants must submit a typed essay (1,000–1,500 words) answering the following questions:
•Why do you see smoking as a problem for individuals and society?
•What is the best way for society to overcome the issue of smoking, and why?
•What would a smoke-free world look like, and how would it differ from the world today?
•What message do you have for current smokers?
The essay must include the word count and be signed with a full name (both first and last name), along with the applicant’s email address, phone number and permanent address.
The winning applicants will be determined based on the essay content, style and originality. Judges are looking for logically organized and well-supported essays. more...

Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from Central Hardin or Ohio County High Schools planning to attend full-time at Western Kentucky University majoring in Chemistry, Physics, Geography, Agriculture, or Nursing. Students must rank in the top 15% of the graduating class. Award amount may vary. more...

Scholarships.Com

School Soup
SchoolSoup.com is the most comprehensive free online scholarship resource for private and college/university specific scholarships available to assist students in obtaining a higher education. Launched in 2006, schoolsoup.com has amassed over $40 Billion in scholarship data and is considered the leading source for students and parents searching for scholarships, grants and financial aid. The SchoolSoup’s Scholarship Directory allows you to browse through our enormous database of scholarships by a variety of key categories. However, with so many available scholarships, we can save you valuable research time by using our FREE scholarship matching platform. Securing Scholarship’s takes time and effort, but it is a key ingredient in pursuing your academic dreams! Change or update your profile on a regular basis to ensure that you are being matched to only those scholarships that closely align to your student profile and to make sure any new scholarships in our database are added to your “My Scholarship” page. BUT HERE’S THE SMALL PRINT. Like any great soup recipe, we can only give you the basics, such as hundreds of suitable scholarship matches. It’s up to you to add the water and stir. That means turning up the heat and actually applying for all of the scholarships matches we give you. more...

The Stella Thompson Lutes Memorial Endowed Scholarship is available to students at Eastern Kentucky University, College of Education. You must have completed your freshman year at EKU majoring in education, with a 3.0 GPA and qualities of good character, leadership, citizenship, promise of high academic achievement and commitment of service to others to qualify for this award. Graduate students who are residents of Kentucky also may apply. more...

Stella Thompson Lutes Memorial Endowed Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for Kentucky residents who are full-time sophomores or older residents attending Eastern Kentucky University who are majoring in Elementary/Middle Grades Education. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Stephen J. Brady Stop Hunger Scholarships
The Stephen J. Brady Stop Hunger Scholarships recognize and reward students who have made a significant impact in the fight against hunger. The scholarship recipients each receive $5,000 for their education as well as a matching grant in their name for the hunger-related charity of their choice. The Stephen J. Brady Stop Hunger Scholarship is named for the Sodexo Foundation’s founder and former president, who was an unstoppable champion in the fight to end hunger. Thanks to Steve’s efforts, which made these scholarships possible, an emerging generation of leaders will be cultivated in the fight against hunger. more...

Stephen Kuhlman Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Graves County, Kentucky who are graduates of Mayfield High School and are incoming freshmen enrolling at Murray State University. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Stephen R. Vaughn Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Illinois or Kentucky who are undergraduate students (freshmen ineligible) attending Murray State University who are majoring in Business or a related field. Applicants must have a minimum 2.75 GPA, be U.S. citizens, and member of the Sigma Chi Fraternity. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Steve Boyce Senior Mathematics Award - Berea College
The Steve Boyce Senior Mathematics Award is available to seniors at Berea College. You must be majoring mathematics and demonstrate the greatest degree of excellence and maturity in your study to be eligible for this award. more...

Steve Hamilton Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for fifth-year seniors attending Morehead State University who have been on athletic scholarships. Applicants must be within 30 credit hours of graduating. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Athletics for more information. more...

Student Publications Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Kentucky State University who are the editor of the yearbook or the newspaper. Award amount covers tuition. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Study Abroad (International) Scholarship
Scholarship for Kentucky residents who are upperclass undergraduate students attending Morehead State University participating in the study-abroad program. Selection based on academic achievement and financial need. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Enrollment Services for more information. more...

Susan Mcevoy Scholarship
The Susan McEvoy Scholarship is available to second-, third- and fourth-year students at the University of Kentucky, College of Dentistry. You must demonstrate outstanding clinical skills with a focus on general restorative dentistry to be eligible for this award. An essay and interview are required. more...

Swim And Aquatics Internship
The Swim and Aquatics Internship is available to graduates with a bachelor's degree. You must have have a working knowledge of the HyTek Systems (Team Manager and Meet Manager), a background in collegiate swimming, and will have swim camp or age group coaching experience. As an intern, you will assist the head coach in recruitment of student-athletes in accordance with college policy, meet coaching, conduct practices, organize team travel, monitor student-athletes' academic and social progress, equipment maintenance and purchases, fund-raising and administrative duties required to develop a competitive swimming program. more...

Thaddeus Colson & Isabelle Saalwaechter Fitzpatrick Memorial Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for female Kentucky residents who are undergraduate students (freshmen ineligible) attending full-time at Eastern Kentucky University, Kentucky State University, Morehead State University, Murray State University, Northern Kentucky University, University of Kentucky, University of Louisville, or Western Kentucky University majoring in an environmentally related program; Agriculture, Biology, Horticulture, Environmental Studies, Environmental Engineering, etc.. Students must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA, demonstrate financial need, and demonstrate a commitment to the environment. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Dependents children must be under the age of 23. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Veterans Dependents Scholarship (507)
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Northern Kentucky University who are dependents of wartime servicemen, or deceased servicemen while on active duty or is deceased due to a service connected disability while on active duty. Servicemen must have been Kentucky residents at the time of of service. Dependent children must be 23 years of age or younger. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at Western Kentucky University Department of Curriculum and Instruction majoring in Elementary Education or Early Childhood Education. Students must have a teaching mission, creative input, positive relationship qualities, be focused on children, and be nominated. Special consideration given to students who are single parents. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Warren & Winifred Proudfoot Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Morehead State University who are majoring in Pre-Health or Pre-Medicine. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Imaging Sciences or the Department of Nursing for more information. more...

Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from Warren Central High School planning to attend full-time at Western Kentucky University. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and a minimum 19 ACT score. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Wayne T. Harrell Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Marshall County, Kentucky who are upperclassmen attending Murray State University and are majoring in Nursing or Pre-Med. Applicants must have financial need. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Weekly Scholarship Alert
You have tried the college scholarship databases and they gave you a list of 500 or more college scholarships, and you just don’t know where to start, so you don’t.
You are in luck.
Weekly Scholarship Alert is the free service that delivers a link to your inbox each week. Follow the link to receive a manageable 5-10 college scholarship announcements.
Will you qualify for all of them? Probably not.
But you will get the scholarships in easy to handle bits, so you don’t get overwhelmed.
You will notice that our list has scholarships for students in grade school through Graduate school and everyone in between, so stay with us until you are finished with your schooling!
In fact, there are twice as many scholarships for students attending college than for high school students, so keep watching our list until your higher education is complete.
The two most common reasons subscribers give for unsubscribing is:
I got accepted to college (you still have 4 years to pay for…)
and
I don’t qualify for all of these scholarships. (Duh! – Nobody does. Apply for the ones that you do qualify for.)
Searching for college money is a year-round process, not a seasonal event, so you will receive these notices each week, not just during the school year.
We won’t send college scholarships that require you to attend a specific school either.
We also try to give you 4-6 weeks before the deadlines!
Privacy Policy: We will not give, sell, transfer or otherwise let other people get your information. The sponsors of this service will place ads in your weekly list. They will not contact you in any other manner unless you request it.
Please fill out the subscription form to receive your college scholarship announcement emails.
This is the only information we will ask for.
No “profiles”.
No long forms to fill out.
You can even make up the first name that you give us.
Don’t make up the email address, or you won’t get your college scholarship information. more...

Applicants must have a minimum ACT score of 21 and graduated in the top 25% of class. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Recipients must attend the National Farm Machinery Show banquet and assist with the School of Agriculture recruiting booth. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship
The Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship seeks to attract talented, committed individuals with backgrounds in the STEM fields-science, technology, engineering, and mathematics-into teaching in high-need secondary schools in Georgia, Indiana, and New Jersey. Eligible applicants include current undergraduates, recent college graduates, midcareer professionals, and retirees who have majored in, or had careers in, STEM fields.The Fellowship also works to change the way top teachers are prepared, partnering with colleges and universities that have agreed to provide Fellows with innovative, year-long classroom experiences, rigorous academic work, and ongoing mentoring. more...

Yearlings Scholarship
Scholarship for female residents of Boone, Campbell, or Kenton counties, Kentucky who are undergraduate students attending Northern Kentucky University. Applicants must at least 25 years of age, have financial need, and a minimum 3.0 GPA. Number of awards and award amount varies. Nonrenewable. more...
